Module blaster.py¶

modules.blaster.blastn_blaster(query_path, dict_path, outfile_path, perc_identity)¶

This module calls for blastn in the BLASTR command line. See Command Line Application User Manual for more information.

Parameters

  • query_path (string) – Path to our FASTA query used in BLASTn against our database.

  • dict_path (string) – Path to the FASTA file query_path will be launched to. In the same directory should be the BLAST data base created with blastn_dic().

  • outfile_path (string) – Path where the results will be saved.

  • perc_identity (string) – Percent of sequence identity which we want to make the BLASTn. Important.

Returns

A CSV file with the results of the BLASTn.

Return type

CSV file

Arguments used in blastn¶

Argument

Type

Description

-word_size

integer
28 by default.
BLAST search starts with finding a perfect sequence match of length given by this parameter.
See world_size info for more information.

-query

string

Query file name.

-db

string

BLAST database name.

-out

string

Output file name.

-perc_identity

integer

Percent identity cutoff.

-outfmt

string
Alignment view options. Written inside in a nested string.
Explained in Table
See Command Line Application User Manual and Metagenomics BLASTn manual for help.
Arguments used in --outfmt inside blastn¶

Argument

Description

10

Comma-separated values.

qseqid
Query Seq-id.
ID of our query sequence.

sseqid
Subject Seq-id.
ID of our subject sequence.

pident

Percentage of identical matches.

length

Alignment length.

qlen

Query sequence length.

slen

Subject sequence length.

mismatch

Number of mismatches.

gapopen

Number of gap openings.

qstart

Start of alignment in query.

qend

End of alignment in query.

sstart

Start of alignment in subject.

send

End of alignment in subject.

evalue

Expect value.

bitscore

Bit score.

sstrand

Subject strand.

sseq

Aligned part of subject sequence.
modules.blaster.blastn_dic(path_input)¶

Creation af a BLAST database of our whole genome. It uses the BLASTR command line, see BLAST Command Line Application User Manual for more information.

The generation of the properly database will be placed in the directory where path_input is. It is recommended to use a dedicated folder to this FASTA file so the database is written next to it.

Parameters

path_input (string) – path to a FASTA file.

Returns

a BLAST database.

Return type

Muitiples files (.nhr, .nin, .nog, .nsd, .nsi and .nsq extensions)

modules.blaster.repetitive_blaster(genome_fasta, path_input, folder_path, naming_short, max_diff, numbering, maximun_runs)¶

This function will iterate till a number of maximun_runs defined.

Parameters

  • genome_fasta (string) – Path to our whole genome sequence in .fasta.

  • path_input (string) – Path to the main CSV file where data will be filtered. Initially is a CSV file wich was output from blastn_blaster() alone to obtain the initial data.

  • folder_path (string) – Path to a folder where the results will be placed. Subfolder will be created with the cromosome names.

  • naming_short (string) – Label needed to read the ID of each cromosome in the .csv file. In the case of L. infantum for example, would be LinJ since the .csv file IDs are LinJ.XX

  • max_diff (integer) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important

  • numbering (integer) – Indicates the number showed for the first program run. If it’s 0, then, the first run will be name 0.

  • maximun_runs (integer) – Indicates the last iterative execution of function.

Warning

Pay special attention to the max_diff argument.
